ESLint is probaby the best tool to improve quality of your JavaScript code, but sometimes it just gets in the way. Also, I forget how to turn off rule for a file and I've searched that more times than I would like to admit. Enough is enough, at least I'll know where to find it next time.

/* eslint rule-name: 0 */
  • Keyword is actually eslint. I always remember eslint-disable or eslint-disable-file and get frustrated because it doesn't work.
  • Double slash comments (// ...) can't be used here for some weird reason. Learned it the hard way, multiple times.
  • If you are feeling particulary awesome today, you can increase number to 1 for warning or 2 for error.
